summary: This is a declaration by attorney Sigrid S. McCawley in support of the plaintiff's response to defendant Ghislaine Maxwell's motion for a protective order in a civil case. The filing includes the proposed protective order, which aims to govern the handling of confidential information, including sensitive personal information relating to victims of sexual abuse. This is a protective order filed in a civil case (Case 1:15-cv-07433-RWS) establishing procedures for handling confidential and highly confidential discovery material. It outlines the designation process, restrictions on use, procedures for challenging designations, and disposition of materials at the conclusion of the case.

persons.name: Sigrid S. McCawley

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the civil case, against whom the plaintiff is seeking a protective order for discovery materials.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Attorney for defendant Ghislaine Maxwell, referenced in email correspondence regarding the proposed protective order.

persons.name: David Boies
persons.context: Attorney from Boies, Schiller & Flexner LLP listed as counsel for the plaintiff.

persons.name: Ellen Brockman
persons.context: Attorney from Boies, Schiller & Flexner LLP listed as counsel for the plaintiff.

events.title: Notice of Deposition of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Plaintiff files a notice to take a videotaped deposition of defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Email Correspondence on Protective Order
events.description: Defense counsel Laura Menninger sends email correspondence to plaintiff's attorney Sigrid McCawley regarding the proposed protective order.

events.title: Filing of Declaration and Proposed Protective Order
events.description: Sigrid S. McCawley files this declaration and the proposed protective order with the court in opposition to defendant's motion.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The document is part of a civil case (15-cv-07433) where the plaintiff is opposing Ghislaine Maxwell's motion for a protective order.
The proposed protective order specifically aims to protect 'sensitive personal information relating to a victim of sexual abuse' among other confidential information.
The protective order defines confidential information as covering the privacy protections of the plaintiff, defendant Ghislaine Maxwell, and 'any non-party that was subject to sexual abuse.'
The filing indicates active discovery, including a noticed deposition of Ghislaine Maxwell.
The document establishes formal legal procedures for handling sensitive material related to allegations of sexual abuse.
This is a protective order governing the handling of confidential discovery in a civil case related to the Epstein matter.
The order establishes two levels of confidentiality: 'CONFIDENTIAL' and 'HIGHLY CONFIDENTIAL-ATTORNEYS' EYES ONLY'.
The order includes provisions for inadvertent production of confidential material and allows for retroactive designation.
The order states that confidential information can be used for law enforcement purposes without restriction.
The protective order will have no force and effect on the use of confidential information at trial.
